channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: States are cutting Medicaid provider payments long before Trump cuts hit
item.description: North Carolina and Idaho have cut their Medicaid programs to bridge budget gaps, raising fears that providers will stop taking patients and that hospitals will close even before the brunt of a new federal tax-and-budget law takes effect.
item.content:encoded:
North Carolina and Idaho have cut their Medicaid programs to bridge budget gaps, raising fears that providers will stop taking patients and that hospitals will close even before the brunt of a new federal tax-and-budget law takes effect.

(Image credit: Aaron Marco)
item.dc:creator: Bram Sable-Smith

item.title: At least 5 dead in large-scale nighttime Russian strike on Ukraine
item.description: At least five civilians died after Russia launched a major nighttime attack on Ukraine overnight into Sunday, a barrage which officials said targeted civilian infrastructure.
item.content:encoded:
At least five civilians died after Russia launched a major nighttime attack on Ukraine overnight into Sunday, a barrage which officials said targeted civilian infrastructure.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: With makeshift jump ropes and hide and seek, kids play to cope with crisis
item.description: From Gaza to Ukraine to South Sudan, children play to deal with the stress — and find a moment of joy.
item.content:encoded:
From Gaza to Ukraine to South Sudan, children play to deal with the stress — and find a moment of joy.

(Image credit: Danielle Villasana)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: The mother of Colombian corals
item.description: Known as the mother of Colombian corals, at 70, marine biologist Elvira Alvarado is still diving — and pioneering "coral IVF" to help save endangered reefs.
item.content:encoded:
Known as the mother of Colombian corals, at 70, marine biologist Elvira Alvarado is still diving — and pioneering "coral IVF" to help save endangered reefs.

(Image credit: John Otis)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: How apple cider vinegar cured everything — until it didn't
item.description: A headline-grabbing study touting apple cider vinegar for weight loss has been retracted. Other claims for the internet-famous remedy are also under fire.
item.content:encoded:
A headline-grabbing study touting apple cider vinegar for weight loss has been retracted. Other claims for the internet-famous remedy are also under fire.

(Image credit: Jeremy Drey)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Why Gen Z protesters worldwide are flying an anime pirate flag
item.description: Gen Z protesters from Indonesia and Nepal to Madagascar and Morocco, are rallying behind an unexpected banner: a grinning skull in a straw hat.
item.content:encoded:
Gen Z protesters from Indonesia and Nepal to Madagascar and Morocco, are rallying behind an unexpected banner: a grinning skull in a straw hat.

(Image credit: Claudio Pramana)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: What to expect as Syria holds first parliamentary elections since Assad's ouster
item.description: Syria is holding parliamentary elections on Sunday for the first time since the fall of the country's longtime autocratic leader, Bashar Assad, who was unseated in a rebel offensive in December.
item.content:encoded:
Syria is holding parliamentary elections on Sunday for the first time since the fall of the country's longtime autocratic leader, Bashar Assad, who was unseated in a rebel offensive in December.

(Image credit: Omar Sanadiki)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Some Democrats share Trump's goal of forcing more homeless people into medical care
item.description: President Trump says one part of the answer to homelessness is civil commitment and forced medical care. Some Democrats agree.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says one part of the answer to homelessness is civil commitment and forced medical care. Some Democrats agree.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump's National Guard deployment to Portland
item.description: A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Portland, Ore., which the president had ordered over the objections of local leaders.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deploying the National Guard to Portland, Ore., which the president had ordered over the objections of local leaders.

(Image credit: Jenny Kane)
item.dc:creator: Conrad Wilson

item.title: Largest US Lutheran denomination installs first Black presiding bishop
item.description: Rev. Yehiel Curry succeeds Rev. Elizabeth Eaton, who served for 12 years and was the first woman to lead the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.
item.content:encoded:
Rev. Yehiel Curry succeeds Rev. Elizabeth Eaton, who served for 12 years and was the first woman to lead the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.

(Image credit: Talia Sprague)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
